governance.title: Governance and Compliance
governance.description: ELP Green Technology maintains the highest standards of corporate governance, with independent audits by Big Four firms and full alignment with international regulations.
governance.boardDesc: Our board of directors brings together professionals with decades of experience in M&A, chemical engineering, sustainable finance and environmental regulation, ensuring a global and diversified strategic vision.

about.quote: Together, we can build a sustainable world and transform challenges into opportunities for a better future.
about.companyDesc1: ELP GREEN TECHNOLOGY is a company committed to promoting innovative and sustainable solutions to global challenges. Based on sustainability, advanced technologies and strategic partnerships, our company seeks to transform environmental problems into business opportunities.
about.companyDesc2: Our goal is to create a future where sustainability is the foundation of all our actions. We seek to implement advanced technologies, efficient waste management practices and renewable energy sources to reduce carbon emissions and combat climate change.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: To lead the global transformation of waste into resources, connecting cutting-edge technology to sustainable capital.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To develop and implement technological solutions that transform environmental liabilities into high-value economic assets.

ericson.bio: Founder and Chairman of the Board of ELP Green Technology and ELP Global S.A. Visionary and entrepreneur, leads the company's global expansion establishing strategic partnerships for OTR tire recycling in Europe, Asia and Latin America. Responsible for the ELP brand registered in 6 classes at INPI. Current focus: Joint Ventures for Smart Line OTR.

xuShihe.role: Affiliate Member & Managing Director - China Operations
xuShihe.bio: Managing Director of TOPS RECYCLING ZHANGJIAGANG SHILONG MACHINERY CO. LTD, official partner of ELP Green Technology since February 22, 2023. Specialist in Smart Line equipment for recycling giant OTR tires. Responsible for manufacturing operations and robotic cutting technology.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: How we protect your personal data

intro.title: 1. Introduction
intro.text: ELP Green Technology is committed to protecting the privacy of its users. This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, store and protect your personal information in accordance with the General Data Protection Law (LGPD) and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

dataCollected.title: 2. Data Collected
dataCollected.text: We collect the following types of data:

items.identification: Identification data: name, email, phone, company
items.navigation: Navigation data: cookies, IP address, usage data
items.communication: Communication data: messages sent through forms

items.respond: Respond to requests and provide information about our services
items.newsletter: Send newsletters and relevant communications (with consent)
items.legal: Comply with legal and regulatory obligations

rights.title: 4. Your Rights
rights.text: You have the right to access, correct, delete or port your personal data. To exercise these rights, contact us via email

contact.title: 5. Contact
contact.text: For questions about this policy or the processing of your data, contact:

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.subtitle: General conditions for using the site

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.text: By accessing and using this site, you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of use established here. If you disagree with any part of these terms, you should not use our site.

siteUsage.title: 2. Site Usage
siteUsage.text: The content of this site is provided for general informational purposes only. ELP Green Technology reserves the right to modify, suspend or discontinue any aspect of the site at any time.

intellectualProperty.title: 3. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.text1: All content on this site, including texts, graphics, logos, icons, images, audio clips and software, is the property of ELP Green Technology or its content providers and is protected by national and international copyright laws.
intellectualProperty.text2: The ELP brand is registered with INPI (National Institute of Industrial Property) in classes 1, 7, 35, 40 and 42, valid until 07/11/2033.

liability.title: 4. Limitation of Liability
liability.text: ELP Green Technology will not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special or consequential damages resulting from the use or inability to use this site or its services.

externalLinks.title: 5. External Links
externalLinks.text: This site may contain links to third-party sites. These links are provided for convenience only and do not imply endorsement or responsibility for the content of those sites.

applicableLaw.title: 6. Applicable Law
applicableLaw.text: These terms will be governed and interpreted in accordance with the laws of Brazil, without conflict with legal provisions.

contact.title: 7. Contact
contact.text: For questions about these terms, contact:

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.subtitle: How we use cookies on our site

what.title: What are Cookies?
what.text: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and provide information to site owners.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.text: Necessary for the basic functioning of the site. Without them, the site would not work properly.

performance.title: Performance Cookies
performance.text: Collect information about how visitors use the site, allowing us to improve the user experience.

functionality.title: Functionality Cookies
functionality.text: Allow the site to remember choices you make (such as your preferred language) and provide enhanced features.

manage.title: How to Manage Cookies
manage.text: You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. However, if you do this, you may need to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.text: In some cases, we use trusted third-party cookies. The following section details which third-party cookies you may find on this site:
thirdParty.googleAnalytics: Google Analytics - for site usage analysis

moreInfo.title: More Information
moreInfo.text: For more information about how we use cookies and your personal data, see our

index.pyrolysisDesc: Our state-of-the-art pyrolysis technology operates in a closed loop, ensuring zero emissions and maximum energy efficiency.
index.modularDesc: Our Skid-Mounted plants are prefabricated and transported as complete modules, drastically reducing installation time.

process.step1Desc: Waste is collected and classified for processing.
process.step2Desc: Material is prepared and fragmented for reactor input.
process.step3Desc: Thermal decomposition in controlled oxygen-free environment.
process.step4Desc: Products are separated: oil, gas, carbon black and metals.
process.step5Desc: Each product is refined to meet market specifications.
process.step6Desc: Certified commodities are sold on the global market.

products.rcbDesc: Sustainable substitute for virgin carbon black for rubber and plastics industry.
products.pyrolyticOilDesc: Alternative fuel or feedstock for refineries and chemical industry.
products.greenSteelDesc: Steel recovered from tire recycling process, ready for industrial reuse.
products.syngasDesc: Energy to power the process itself, making the operation self-sufficient.

tireRecycling.title: Tire Recycling Plant
tireRecycling.subtitle: Complete Processing System
tireRecycling.description: Fully automatic system for recycling used tires, producing high-quality rubber granules and powder.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to the most common questions about our recycling plants and processes.
faq.stillQuestionsDesc: Our team is ready to help. Contact us and we'll answer your questions.

tireRecycling.q1: What is the processing capacity of a tire recycling plant?
tireRecycling.a1: Our tire recycling plants have a capacity of 1 to 10 tons per hour, depending on the model chosen. Operating 24/7, an average plant can process up to 30,000 tons of tires per year.
tireRecycling.q2: What are the final products of tire recycling?
tireRecycling.a2: The main products are: granulated rubber (60-65%), high-quality steel (25-30%) and textile fibers (10-15%). The rubber can be sold for flooring, modified asphalt and new rubber products.
tireRecycling.q3: How long does it take to install a complete plant?
tireRecycling.a3: Complete installation takes 3 to 6 months, including site preparation, equipment assembly, testing and team training. We offer technical support throughout the process.
tireRecycling.q4: What is the initial investment required?
tireRecycling.a4: Investment varies from $2 million to $10 million depending on capacity and configuration. We offer different financing models and partnerships to make your project viable.
tireRecycling.q5: What certifications and licenses are required?
tireRecycling.a5: Our equipment has CE and ISO certification. We assist in obtaining local environmental licenses and provide complete documentation for regulatory approval.

pyrolysis.q1: What is pyrolysis and how does it work?
pyrolysis.a1: Pyrolysis is a thermochemical process that decomposes organic materials in the absence of oxygen at temperatures of 400-600¬∞C. It transforms tires into pyrolytic oil, carbon black and recovered steel.
pyrolysis.q2: What is the yield of a pyrolysis plant?
pyrolysis.a2: For every 10 tons of tires, we obtain approximately: 4-4.5 tons of oil, 3-3.5 tons of carbon black, 1.5 tons of steel and 1 ton of gas (used as fuel).
pyrolysis.q3: Is the pyrolysis process safe and environmentally friendly?
pyrolysis.a3: Yes, our plants use advanced emission control systems and operate in a closed loop. The gas produced is reused as fuel, making the process highly efficient and sustainable.
pyrolysis.q4: What is pyrolytic oil used for?
pyrolysis.a4: Pyrolytic oil can be used as industrial fuel, refined to diesel or sold to chemical industries. It has high calorific value and significant market value.
pyrolysis.q5: What is the lifespan of a pyrolysis plant?
pyrolysis.a5: With proper maintenance, our plants have a lifespan of 15-20 years. We offer preventive maintenance contracts and spare parts to ensure continuous operation.

otr.q1: What are OTR tires and where do they come from?
otr.a1: OTR means "Off-The-Road" ‚Äì these are giant tires used in mining, ports, agriculture and construction. They can weigh up to 4.5 tons and have a diameter of up to 4.5 meters.
otr.q2: Why do OTR tires require special equipment?
otr.a2: Due to their extreme size and weight, OTR tires cannot be processed in conventional shredders. Our OTR line was specifically developed to cut, separate and process these giant tires.
otr.q3: What is the processing capacity of the OTR line?
otr.a3: Our complete OTR line processes 10 to 20 tons per hour, equivalent to 3-5 giant mining tires per hour, operating 24/7 with only 2-3 operators per shift.
otr.q4: What is the value of recycled OTR tire products?
otr.a4: OTR tires contain high-quality rubber and steel. Rubber blocks are sold at $0.35/kg, steel at $0.55/kg and fibers at $0.20/kg, generating excellent return on investment.
otr.q5: Do you offer training for OTR line operation?
otr.a5: Yes, we offer complete 2-4 week training for your team, including operation, preventive maintenance and safety. We also provide 24/7 remote technical support.

quotation.q1: How do I request a quote?
quotation.a1: You can request a quote through our website by filling out the form on each plant page, or by contacting us directly via email or phone. We will respond within 48 business hours.
quotation.q2: What information is required for a quote?
quotation.a2: We need to know: type of material to process, desired capacity (ton/hour or ton/day), project location, available infrastructure (power, water, space) and implementation timeline.
quotation.q3: How long does it take to receive a commercial proposal?
quotation.a3: After initial analysis, we send a preliminary proposal in 5-7 business days. A detailed technical proposal is provided after a technical visit or in-depth project analysis, within 15 days.
quotation.q4: Do you offer financing or leasing?
quotation.a4: Yes, we work with financial partners to offer financing, leasing and operational partnership options. Each case is analyzed individually to find the best solution.
quotation.q5: What is included in the equipment price?
quotation.a5: Our prices include: complete equipment, technical documentation, initial training, installation supervision and 12-24 month warranty. Freight and installation are quoted separately based on location.
quotation.q6: Do you conduct technical visits before the sale?
quotation.a6: Yes, for large projects, we conduct free technical visits to the installation site. We also invite clients to visit our facilities and see the equipment in operation.

tireShredder.name: Tire Shredder
tireShredder.description: Dual-shaft tire shredding system, available in mobile and fixed versions. Designed for on-site shredding, reducing transportation costs.
specs: Mobile version with trailer and generator

rubberGranulator.name: Rubber Granulator
rubberGranulator.description: Produces 25-12mm wire-free rubber chips. Equipped with replaceable wear plates and reversible blades for maximum efficiency.

crackerMill.name: Cracker Mill
crackerMill.description: Converts rubber chips into granules and powder. Used as feedstock for pyrolysis, artificial turf or modified asphalt.

debeader.name: Debeader
debeader.description: Removes both steel beads simultaneously in 10-15 seconds. Increases shredder capacity and protects blades.

otrTireCutter.name: OTR Tire Cutter
otrTireCutter.description: Processes giant mining and agricultural tires (up to 59/80R63 of 4.5 ton). 3-step process: sidewall cutting, strips and blocks.

pyrolysisPlant.name: Pyrolysis Plant
pyrolysisPlant.description: Continuous and batch systems for pyrolysis of tires and plastics. Extracts industrial oil and recovered carbon black (rCB).

rubberPowderLine.name: Rubber Powder Line
rubberPowderLine.description: Produces superfine rubber powder for reclaimed rubber and modified asphalt. Complete classification and screening system.

reclaimedRubberLine.name: Reclaimed Rubber Line
reclaimedRubberLine.description: Includes devulcanizers, mixing mills and refiners. Transforms rubber powder into high-quality reclaimed rubber.

giantTire.name: Giant OTR Tire
giantTire.description: Scale demonstration of OTR tires we process. Mining tires can weigh up to 4.5 tons and have 4.5m diameter.

shredder.name: Industrial OTR Shredder
shredder.description: High-capacity shredder for processing cut OTR tires. Robust system for 24/7 continuous operation.

processing.description: Giant OTR tire preparation and processing area before shredding.

beadWire.description: Bead rings extracted from OTR tires, ready for sale to steel mills and foundries.

templateViewer.notFoundDescription: The requested template is not available or has been disabled.
templateViewer.instruction: Fill in the fields below to complete the document
templateViewer.successDescription: We received your completed document. Our team will contact you soon.
templateViewer.signDescription: Add your digital signature to validate the document.
templateViewer.legalNotice: By signing, you confirm that you have read and agree to the terms of this document. Your signature is protected by SHA-256 encryption and has legal validity according to Law 14.063/2020 (Brazil) and the eIDAS Regulation (European Union).
